Title.evidence: A Randomised Controlled Trial Comparing General Anesthesia Plus Local Infiltration with Spinal Anesthesia for Hemorrhoidectomy

Participants.evidence: Participants were patients undergoing excisional hemorrhoidectomy between January 1, 2017, and March 31, 2023. Eligibility criteria included patients aged ≥20 years with ASA scores <3.

Intervention.evidence: compare the effects of general anesthesia plus local infiltration (GAL) versus spinal anesthesia (SA)

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to compare the effects of general anesthesia plus local infiltration (GAL) versus spinal anesthesia (SA) on postoperative complications and pain.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was acute urine retention (AUR) within 24 hours post-surgery.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomization and blinding details were not applicable due to the retrospective design.

Blinding.evidence: Randomization and blinding details were not applicable due to the retrospective design.

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 550 patients were included: 220 in the GAL group and 330 in the SA group.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The AUR rate was significantly lower in the GAL group compared to the SA group (15.5% vs. 32.1%, P < 0.001).

Harms.evidence: The GAL group had a lower overall rate of adverse effects (56.9% vs. 67.4%, P = 0.023).
